metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7218 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The HTTP/2 implementation in Mozilla Firefox before 43.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (integer underflow, assertion failure, and application exit) via a single-byte header frame that triggers incorrect memory allocation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7218` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
